DOC.HEAD: Grinches Too Busy Guzzling Beer to Notice Christmas Toys in Stolen Van
DOC.TEXT: The Grinches who stole Victor Diaz's van were too busy guzzling two six-packs of beer he left on a front seat to notice a load of Christmas toys in the back worth more than $500. ``My jaws dropped when I saw the toys in there,'' Diaz said Wednesday. ``Every hair on my body went up. The officer said, `This never happens.''' He had worried his family's Christmas was ruined after the van was stolen from their driveway Monday night. But the only things missing when he found the van in suburban Pacoima the next day were 12 beers, a set of wrenches, a small stool-like table and pink bunny purse belonging to Diaz's daughter. Diaz had spent two hours at a toy store Monday night, buying gifts for his four children, ages 3 to 12. He said he spent $564. He planned to hide the toys in the garage after the childre were asleep. But when he went out around 11 p.m., the van was gone.
